item.title: PowerCLI: Getting vmhost uptime
item.description: I love a powershell challenge, and last week a colleague of mine asked me for assistance in getting the uptime of vmware hosts. My initial response did the trick: Get-View -ViewType hostsystem -Property name,runtime.boottime | Select-Object Name, @{N="UptimeDays"; E={((((get-date) - ($_.runtime).BootTime).TotalDays).Tostring()).Substring(0,5)}} However, I wasnâ€™t completely satisfied by the the output or the ease of use. So today I went back and rewrote the code and made a function of it.
